text: Getty Images On Tuesday, NBC announced that Hoda Kotb would join coanchor Savannah Guthrie as the permanent replacement for Matt Lauer on the ` ` Today'' show. But her salary won't compare to his. ` ` I'm not making Matt Lauer money,'' Kotb told People. ` ` Not even close.'' Kotb, who has been with the network since 1998, had been filling in for Lauer since he was fired from NBC in November for ` ` inappropriate sexual behavior.'' Kotb has also cohosted the fourth hour of ` ` Today'' with Kathie Lee Gifford since 2008, and will continue to do so moving forward, according to NBC. Page Six reports ( citing ` ` NBC sources'' )
